decks.notes: This deck focuses on using a toolbox approach with creatures to enable powerful combos. The key strategy involves tutoring for specific creatures with cards like Chord of Calling and Summoner's Pact to create game-winning interactions. Cards like Springheart Nantuko and Delighted Halfling provide utility and support for the combo pieces. The land base includes variety of utility lands like Urza's Saga and Boseiju, Who Endures to help in different situations. The deck aims to assemble the necessary pieces quickly and efficiently to execute a winning combo.

This deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with powerful disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Counterspell while applying pressure with efficient, aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Dragon's Rage Channeler. Mishra's Bauble and Expressive Iteration provide card selection and help enable delve for Drown in the Loch. The deck also has a small land destruction package with Orcish Bowmasters and utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student for additional card advantage. The mana base is streamlined to support the deck's aggressive tempo strategy.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly reanimate powerful creatures from the graveyard using cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Ephemerate, along with tools like Fallaji Archaeologist and Priest of Fell Rites. Other cards like Grief and Solitude help disrupt the opponent's strategy while building towards the combo finish. The inclusion of spells like Tainted Indulgence and Faithful Mending provide additional utility and card advantage. The deck aims to be proactive and versatile, with the ability to control the game while also setting up explosive plays to close out the game.

The primary focus of this deck is to control the game by utilizing powerful counterspells and removal spells, while also leveraging The One Ring as a win condition. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while maintaining card advantage and board control. By utilizing a mix of control elements, card draw, and versatile threats like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury, the deck seeks to outmaneuver opponents and secure victory through attrition and resource management. Additionally, the deck includes various utility lands to support its strategy and provide additional options in different situations.

The main concept of this Modern Aggro Death's Shadow deck is to quickly disrupt the opponent's hand and board state while utilizing the powerful card Death's Shadow as a potent threat. By aggressively attacking the opponent's resources with cards like Grief and Thoughtseize, while also utilizing fast creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Detective's Phoenix, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent and close out games quickly. Additionally, the deck utilizes cards like Dauthi Voidwalker and Not Dead After All to protect its own resources and stay ahead in the game.

The deck focuses on control through a combination of counter spells, removal, and card advantage. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating value and card advantage through cards like Snapcaster Mage and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student. The win condition is often through incremental damage with burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Galvanic Discharge, as well as with powerful threats like Flame of Anor and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury. The deck also utilizes cantrips like Preordain and card draw spells like Tune the Narrative to dig for key pieces and maintain tempo.

The main concept of this Ruby Storm deck is to create a powerful combo using cards like Ral, Monsoon Mage, Ruby Medallion, and rituals like Desperate Ritual and Pyretic Ritual to generate a large amount of mana. This mana is then used to cast spells like Glimpse the Impossible and Past in Flames multiple times, allowing for a potential game-winning turn. Other cards like Reckless Impulse and Wish help to find key combo pieces, while Wrenn's Resolve and Elegant Parlor provide protection and card advantage. The deck focuses on explosive plays and high synergy between cards to overwhelm opponents quickly.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of powerful Eldrazi creatures and disruptive artifacts. The goal is to assemble the UrzaTron lands to generate a large amount of mana and cast devastating spells such as All Is Dust and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger. Karn, the Great Creator is crucial for fetching key artifacts from the sideboard, while Thought-Knot Seer and Devourer of Destiny provide additional disruption and pressure on the opponent. The deck is designed to overwhelm opponents with its powerful threats and disruptive elements.

The key concept of this deck is to utilize the combo potential of Underworld Breach with Grinding Station and Emry, Lurker of the Loch to generate infinite mill and recursion. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Mishra's Bauble help dig for combo pieces while Nadu, Winged Wisdom provides additional card draw. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Unholy Heat and Thassa's Oracle for alternative win conditions. The land base includes Urza's Saga for artifact tutoring and potential token generation. Overall, the deck aims to assemble its combo pieces quickly and efficiently to overwhelm the opponent.

This deck focuses on using a variety of creatures with unique abilities to create powerful combos and control the game. By utilizing creatures like Nadu, Winged Wisdom and Springheart Nantuko, along with support cards like Chord of Calling and Urza's Saga, the deck can assemble different win conditions and adapt to different matchups. The toolbox approach allows the deck to search for specific answers or threats as needed, while also providing a diverse range of options to outmaneuver opponents and secure victory.

This deck focuses on utilizing Hardened Scales to multiply the +1/+1 counters placed on artifacts and creatures, allowing for explosive growth and overwhelming aggression. By using efficient threats like Arcbound Ravager, Hangarback Walker, and Walking Ballista, along with synergistic cards like Zabaz, the Glimmerwasp and The Ozolith, this deck aims to quickly build a board presence that can overpower opponents. With support from cards like Agatha's Soul Cauldron and Welding Jar, this deck can protect its key pieces and maintain pressure on the opponent until victory is achieved.

The primary focus of this Jeskai Control deck is to disrupt and control the opponent's game plan while maintaining card advantage and board control. The deck includes removal spells, counter spells, and powerful creatures like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury to help stabilize and close out the game. The deck aims to control the battlefield through a combination of removal, countermagic, and strong creatures, allowing the pilot to dictate the pace of the game and outvalue the opponent. It excels at grinding out incremental advantages and slowly winning the game through attrition and card advantage.

This deck focuses on using cycling creatures and cascade spells to quickly fill up the graveyard with creatures, then casting Living End to bring them all back onto the battlefield, often overwhelming the opponent with a large number of creatures. The deck also has disruption in the form of counterspells and hand disruption spells to control the game until it can execute its game plan. The combination of card draw, disruption, and powerful combo potential makes this deck a formidable force in Modern 1 vs 1 format.

The main concept of this deck is to heavily disrupt your opponent's strategy with a combination of hand disruption spells like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize, while also controlling the board with removal spells like Fatal Push and Fell the Profane. The deck also aims to ramp up to powerful late-game threats such as Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and utilize combos like Necrodominance and Soul Spike to finish off the opponent. The deck is designed to grind out advantages and win through attrition and overwhelming card advantage.

This deck focuses on fast and aggressive plays, utilizing low-cost creatures like Wild Nacatl and Steppe Lynx to quickly overwhelm the opponent. With support from cards like Atarka's Command and Lightning Bolt for direct damage, the goal is to quickly reduce the opponent's life total to zero. By including cards that provide additional value such as Wrenn and Six and Ajani, Nacatl Pariah, the deck aims to maintain pressure on the opponent while also controlling the board. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds an additional layer of utility to the deck.

This deck focuses on assembling a variety of creatures to generate value and control the board through a toolbox approach. By utilizing cards like Chord of Calling and Grist, the Hunger Tide, the deck can tutor for specific creatures needed in different situations. The inclusion of Yawgmoth, Thran Physician provides additional utility by removing threats and drawing cards. With a mix of resilient creatures like Young Wolf and Agatha's Soul Cauldron, along with disruption in cards like Orcish Bowmasters, this deck aims to create a cohesive game plan to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents.

This deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures combined with burn spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent. It utilizes a diverse mana base to support casting a wide range of spells from multiple colors. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion allows for additional synergy and consistency in the deck. The key strategy is to apply early pressure with efficient creatures, while using removal spells and counterspells to protect them and push for a fast victory.

The foundation of this Boros Aggro deck is aggressive creatures and efficient burn spells to quickly close out games. The inclusion of the Companion Jegantha adds flexibility and consistency to the deck. The strategy focuses on attacking early and often, using cards like Lightning Bolt, Ragavan, and Amped Raptor to apply pressure. Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and Ajani, Nacatl Pariah provide additional threats and ways to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The mana base is carefully constructed for consistent access to the necessary colors and card activations.

This deck focuses on utilizing a toolbox of creatures to efficiently assemble combos and disrupt opponents while maintaining flexibility and versatility. The deck includes various creatures with unique abilities and tutors like Summoner's Pact and Chord of Calling to search for key pieces. The combination of cards like Wall of Roots, Shuko, and Springheart Nantuko allows for multiple win conditions, with Urza's Saga providing additional support. Teferi, Time Raveler helps control the tempo of the game, while lands like Boseiju, Who Endures and Yavimaya, Cradle of Growth offer protection and mana fixing.

The deck focuses on using creatures with unique abilities to search for key pieces of its combo, while also utilizing tools like Chord of Calling and Urza's Saga to tutor for specific cards. The deck aims to create a toolbox of creatures that can disrupt the opponent's game plan and generate value, while also assembling a win condition through a combination of synergy and efficient creature interactions. By using cards like Springheart Nantuko and Delighted Halfling, the deck can establish a strong board presence and control the game tempo, ultimately leading to a successful combo finish.

The deck focuses on using a toolbox of creatures with varied abilities to set up powerful combos and control the game. Cards like Chord of Calling and Urza's Saga are used to search for specific creatures when needed, while cards like Shuko and The One Ring provide additional utility. The deck has strong synergies between cards like Nadu, Winged Wisdom and Delighted Halfling, allowing for explosive plays and strong board presence. The inclusion of mana dorks like Noble Hierarch and Wall of Roots helps to ramp up quickly and support the combo plays.

This deck focuses on utilizing creatures with diverse abilities to assemble a winning combination, providing versatile options through a toolbox approach. The deck includes various creatures with unique abilities such as tutoring for specific creatures, card advantage, protection, and ramping. It also includes cards like Chord of Calling to search for key creatures, along with support cards like Teferi, Time Raveler for disruption. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's combo potential and ensure consistency in executing its game plan.

The deck focuses on using creature toolbox cards to search for and combo off with key creatures like Nadu, Winged Wisdom and Springheart Nantuko. The deck utilizes cards like Summoner's Pact and Chord of Calling to fetch creatures quickly, while also having protection and acceleration cards like Sylvan Safekeeper and Arboreal Grazer. Additionally, the deck utilizes lands like Urza's Saga and Khalni Garden to generate tokens and ramp, allowing for explosive plays and overwhelming board presence.

The main concept of this Mono Black Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan by using hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek, while also removing threats with removal spells like Fatal Push and Necrodominance. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent by constantly generating card advantage and maintaining control of the board with cards like Fell the Profane and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse. The deck finishes off the opponent with powerful cards like Soul Spike and The One Ring, while also having some graveyard recursion with cards like Malakir Rebirth and Boggart Trawler.

The deck focuses on utilizing The One Ring to control the game and gain a strategic advantage. It includes a mix of countermagic, removal spells, and powerful creatures like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury. The deck aims to control the board with cards like Subtlety and Tune the Narrative, while also having versatile removal options such as Galvanic Discharge and Wrath of the Skies. The key to winning with this deck is to carefully manage resources and outplay the opponent through skillful decision-making and leveraging the power of The One Ring.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through a combination of powerful spells and abilities. By utilizing cards like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and The One Ring, this deck can dominate the battlefield while keeping the opponent at bay. Cards like Counterspell, Solitude, and Tune the Narrative help to control the opponent's moves, while cards like Wrath of the Skies and Galvanic Discharge deal with threats on the board. Teferi, Time Raveler adds additional control elements, allowing the player to dictate the pace of the game. With a mix of powerful creatures and disruptive spells, this deck aims to outlast and outsmart the opponent.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's actions through counterspells and removal spells while utilizing The One Ring as a win condition. The deck also includes cards that provide card advantage and disruption, such as Snapcaster Mage and Teferi, Time Raveler. The mana base is designed to provide consistency and flexibility in casting spells of different colors. By controlling the game and gradually building up resources, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and secure victory through powerful plays enabled by The One Ring.

This UR Control deck focuses on disrupting opponents' strategies with counterspells and removal spells while controlling the board with powerful threats like Murktide Regent. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provides card advantage and helps dig through the deck, while cards like Subtlety and Invert Polarity offer additional ways to disrupt opponents. The deck also includes burn spells like Lightning Bolt for extra reach. Overall, the goal of this deck is to outlast opponents by controlling the game and overwhelming them with efficient spells and creatures.

The main strategy of this deck is to ramp up mana quickly using the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Mine, Urza's Tower, Urza's Power Plant) and Expedition Map, in order to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the World Anew and Devourer of Destiny. Control the game with cards like Trinisphere, Ugin's Labyrinth, and Karn, the Great Creator, while disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Kozilek's Command and All Is Dust. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with big threats and lock them out of the game with powerful control elements.

This deck focuses on using the UrzaTron lands to quickly ramp up mana and play powerful Eldrazi creatures. With cards like Expedition Map and Karn, the Great Creator, the deck can search for key pieces and shut down opponent's strategies. The Eldrazi creatures provide strong threats on the battlefield, while cards like All Is Dust clear the way for a powerful attack. The control aspect of the deck comes from counterspells and removal spells, helping to disrupt the opponent's plans and maintain board control.

This deck focuses on utilizing the UrzaTron lands to generate massive amounts of mana and control the game through powerful Eldrazi creatures and disruptive artifacts. By assembling Urza's Mine, Power Plant, and Tower, the deck can quickly ramp into expensive threats like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger and use cards like Chalice of the Void and Trinisphere to disrupt the opponent's game plan. With access to cards like Karn Liberated and Karn, the Great Creator, this deck aims to outvalue and outcontrol the opponent in a Modern 1 vs 1 setting.
